Package Nerdle.Model

Class Combination

  • java.lang.Object
    • Nerdle.Model.Combination
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Answer
    public class Combination
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing one equation consisting of multiple EquationCharacters.

        public Combination​(Difficulty difficulty)

    • Method Detail

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal()
        chacks if the current equation is legal meaning: all EquationCharacters are filled in the is exactly one = when calculated the left side of the equation equals the right side
        Returns:
        true when the equation in the combination is legal

      • calculate

        double calculate​(java.util.List<EquationCharacter> chars)
        parses an array of equation characters to the correct number
        Parameters:
        chars - array of Equation characters (no =) representing a formula
        Returns:
        the result of the calculations

      • compare

        public boolean compare​(Combination other)
                throws NerdleException
        compares this Combination with another one, setting the colors in this Combination
        Parameters:
        other - the correct Combination
        Returns:
        true when all equationCharacters match
        Throws:
        NerdleException

      • addToEnd

        public boolean addToEnd​(EquationCharacter c)
        adds an EquationCharacter to the end of the combination
        Parameters:
        c - EquationCharacter to add
        Returns:
        True when it could be added, False when the Combination is already full

      • addToEnd

        public boolean addToEnd​(char c)
        adds an EquationCharacter to the end of the combination but with a char as input. Used for parsing Strings from files or the consol/test version of the program
        Parameters:
        c - *,/,+,-,= or a number (0-9)
        Returns:
        true when succesfully added, false when Combination is already full

      • deleteLast

        public boolean deleteLast()
        deletes the last EquationCharacter from the Combination
        Returns:
        True when there was an EquationCharacter to remove

      • getCharacters

        public EquationCharacter[] getCharacters()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        used in the console/test version of the game
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        two line string with on first line the equation and on the second line symbols for the colors

      • getCombinationString

        public java.lang.String getCombinationString()
        a string containing only the equation
